metadata.notes: Data compiled from public sources. Fees and requirements may change. Always verify with local AHJ before submitting permits. PE stamp thresholds and fees are approximate and vary by specific project details.

jurisdictions.name: Los Angeles
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: LAFD requires 3-ft setback from ridge and edges. Pathways for firefighter access required per CFC 605.11.

contacts.department: LA Dept of Building and Safety

jurisdictions.notes: AB 2188 mandates streamlined online permitting for rooftop solar <10 kW. Fee cap $450 + $15/kW above 15 kW.

jurisdictions.name: San Diego
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Standard CFC setbacks. Pathways required for rooftop access.
special_requirements: Self-issued permits up to 38.4 kW AC with no plan review
jurisdictions.notes: Residential rooftop PV up to 38.4 kW AC self-issued with no plan review or structural review. Zero permit fee.

jurisdictions.name: San Jose
special_requirements: Instant online permitting for standard systems
jurisdictions.notes: Instant online permitting for standard residential systems. Traditional review mandatory for battery storage or older homes.

jurisdictions.name: San Francisco
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: SFFD setback requirements. Historic district installations may have additional fire access requirements.
jurisdictions.notes: Free solar permits. Historic districts may add several weeks to timeline. City targeting 100% renewable electricity.

jurisdictions.name: Sacramento
special_requirements: Expedited review for systems under 10 kW
jurisdictions.notes: Expedited review for systems under 10 kW. Fees determined by kW based on pre-determined fee schedule.

jurisdictions.name: Fresno
special_requirements: SolarAPP+ instant approval for single-family and duplex
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP+ adopted for instant permits on single-family and duplex projects.

jurisdictions.name: Long Beach
special_requirements: One-step process: submit, pay, receive inspection card same visit
jurisdictions.notes: Streamlined one-step permit process. Submit application, pay fees, receive job inspection card all at once.

jurisdictions.name: Houston
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: 2015 IFC Section 1204.5.1 rapid shutdown. Minimum 4-ft roof access pathways for firefighters.
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP+ implemented July 2024 for streamlined processing. PE stamp required for systems >10 kW. CenterPoint Energy handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: San Antonio
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown requirements. Roof access pathways.
special_requirements: CPS Energy approval required for all installations
jurisdictions.notes: CPS Energy approval required. State-licensed master electrician registered with city of SA required for electrical permit. No ITC available (no net metering market).

jurisdictions.name: Dallas
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Firefighter access pathways required.
jurisdictions.notes: Requires use of two different online portals that are not automatically connected. Multiple city staffers review sequentially, not simultaneously. Can slow the process.

jurisdictions.name: Austin
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard firefighter access pathways.
special_requirements: Austin Energy Distributed Generation Planning Application required
Austin Energy review may be needed before electrical permit
jurisdictions.notes: Streamlined green energy permits with fast-track processing. Austin Energy DG Planning Application required before electrical permit for certain system criteria.

jurisdictions.name: Fort Worth
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard access pathways.
jurisdictions.notes: Streamlined permitting process asks series of questions to determine needed application. Online submission of all required documents.

jurisdictions.name: El Paso
special_requirements: Historic districts require additional plan review
jurisdictions.notes: Older developments and historic districts may require city plan review before permit issuance. Newer areas have straightforward process.

jurisdictions.name: Arlington
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: IFC rapid shutdown. Standard access pathways.
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Texas permitting process. Oncor handles interconnection for the DFW area.

jurisdictions.name: Jacksonville
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Florida Building Code fire setbacks. Standard access pathways.
jurisdictions.notes: HB 683 mandates 5 business day review with auto-approval if missed. Permit fees $125-$275 range. Wind load calcs required.

jurisdictions.name: Miami
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: High-Velocity Hurricane Zone (HVHZ) requirements. Enhanced wind load standards for all solar installations.
special_requirements: HVHZ enhanced wind load standards mandatory
Miami-Dade product approvals may be required
jurisdictions.notes: Strictest solar permitting in Florida due to HVHZ designation. All installations must meet enhanced wind load standards. PE stamp required for virtually all systems.

jurisdictions.name: Tampa
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Florida Building Code fire setbacks. Wind load requirements for coastal location.
jurisdictions.notes: HB 683 5-day review mandate with auto-approval. Residential permits $200-$500 based on system size. Private inspection providers now allowed.

jurisdictions.name: Orlando
jurisdictions.notes: Orange County expedited solar permit program. Fees $100-$300. Most residential reviewed within 3-5 business days.

jurisdictions.name: St. Petersburg
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Florida Building Code setbacks. Coastal wind load requirements.
jurisdictions.notes: HB 683 5-day review mandate. Duke Energy Florida serves most of the area.

jurisdictions.name: Hialeah
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: HVHZ requirements same as Miami-Dade County.
jurisdictions.notes: In Miami-Dade County HVHZ zone. Same strict wind load requirements as Miami.

jurisdictions.name: Port St. Lucie
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Florida Building Code setbacks. Wind load requirements.
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Florida permitting with HB 683 5-day mandate.

jurisdictions.name: Phoenix
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Phoenix Fire Dept requires separate permit for PV and battery storage systems. Standard setbacks.
special_requirements: Separate Phoenix Fire Dept permit required
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP+ approved designs accepted. $300 roof-mounted permit includes all plan reviews and inspection. Separate fire department permit required.

jurisdictions.name: Tucson
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Standard fire setbacks. Pima County may have additional requirements.
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP accepted for residential PV. Tucson Electric Power handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: Mesa
special_requirements: APS or SRP interconnection depending on location
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Arizona permitting. Split between APS and SRP service territories.

jurisdictions.name: Chandler
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Arizona permitting process. SRP service territory.

jurisdictions.name: Scottsdale
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Arizona permitting process.

jurisdictions.name: Gilbert
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Arizona permitting. SRP service territory.

jurisdictions.name: Glendale
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Arizona permitting. APS service territory.

jurisdictions.name: New York City
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: NYC Fire Code setbacks. Access pathways required. NYC-specific fire safety requirements.
special_requirements: Registered Design Professional for plan filing
jurisdictions.notes: Requires NYC-Licensed Master Electrician and Registered Design Professional. Complete applications reviewed in 5-10 days. Property tax abatement for solar installations.

jurisdictions.name: Buffalo
jurisdictions.notes: Uses NYS Unified Solar Permit. Fees $50-$150 range. Expedited for systems under 25 kW.

jurisdictions.name: Rochester
jurisdictions.notes: Uses NYS Unified Solar Permit. Standard processing.

jurisdictions.name: Albany
jurisdictions.notes: Uses NYS Unified Solar Permit.

jurisdictions.name: Syracuse
jurisdictions.notes: Uses NYS Unified Solar Permit.

jurisdictions.name: Charlotte
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NC permitting. Duke Energy Carolinas handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: Raleigh
special_requirements: Same-day online permitting via Permit Portal
jurisdictions.notes: Most residential rooftop solar eligible for same-day online permitting. Work must begin within 6 months.

jurisdictions.name: Greensboro
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NC permitting process.

jurisdictions.name: Durham
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NC permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Denver
special_requirements: CO law caps permit fees at $500
jurisdictions.notes: SolarAPP+ adopted. Colorado HB21-1284 caps residential solar permit fees at $500 through Dec 2029.

jurisdictions.name: Colorado Springs
jurisdictions.notes: Home-rule city handles building and electrical permits locally. CO fee cap applies.

jurisdictions.name: Aurora
jurisdictions.notes: Standard CO permitting with $500 fee cap.

jurisdictions.name: Las Vegas
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Panels must not extend beyond highest roofline point. Standard setbacks.
jurisdictions.notes: Residential permit fees $200-$400. NV Energy charges $35 non-refundable submittal fee. Rooftop panels cannot extend beyond highest roofline.

jurisdictions.name: Henderson
jurisdictions.notes: Clark County permit process. Standard Nevada requirements.

jurisdictions.name: Reno
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Standard setbacks. Not within 30 ft of public right-of-way.
special_requirements: Panels not within 30 ft of street curb
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Nevada permitting. Timeline 30-120 days total including all phases.

jurisdictions.name: North Las Vegas
jurisdictions.notes: Standard Nevada permitting in Clark County.

jurisdictions.name: Boston
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Massachusetts fire code setbacks. Historical district review may apply.
jurisdictions.notes: Same-day in-person and online permitting available. Structural reviews required for most systems. SMART solar incentive program.

jurisdictions.name: Worcester
jurisdictions.notes: Online permitting available. Standard MA process.

jurisdictions.name: Atlanta
jurisdictions.notes: Online solar permit applications. DeKalb County permit fee approximately $445. Urban area may have longer processing due to volume.

jurisdictions.name: Augusta
jurisdictions.notes: Online permit applications available. Standard GA process.

jurisdictions.name: Savannah
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Standard IFC setbacks. Historic district restrictions.
special_requirements: Historic district review may be required
jurisdictions.notes: Historic district (one of largest in US) may require additional review for solar installations.

jurisdictions.name: Philadelphia
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Philadelphia fire code setbacks. Historic district rules.
jurisdictions.notes: DVRPC working to standardize solar PV permit processes across Greater Philadelphia. SREC market provides additional revenue.

jurisdictions.name: Pittsburgh
jurisdictions.notes: Part of Western PA Rooftop Solar Challenge. Standard PA permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Newark
jurisdictions.notes: NJ PV permit fees are kW-based: 1-50 kW=$65, 51-100 kW=$129, >100 kW=$640. Strong SREC-II incentive market.

jurisdictions.name: Jersey City
jurisdictions.notes: NJ standardized PV fee schedule. $65 for systems up to 50 kW.

jurisdictions.name: Charleston
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Coastal wind load requirements. Hurricane zone standards.
special_requirements: Certified engineer plans for historic areas
jurisdictions.notes: Historic district has strict requirements. Permit $300-$500. Residential systems limited to 20 kW AC per SC law.

jurisdictions.name: Columbia
jurisdictions.notes: Standard SC permitting. 20 kW AC residential limit.

jurisdictions.name: Greenville
special_requirements: Sealed structural review with plan view required
jurisdictions.notes: Greenville County requires sealed/signed structural review with plan view of panel system. 20 kW AC limit.

jurisdictions.name: Virginia Beach
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Coastal wind load requirements. Standard IFC setbacks.
special_requirements: Coastal wind load calcs may be required
jurisdictions.notes: Standard VA permitting. Coastal location may require wind load calculations.

jurisdictions.name: Richmond
jurisdictions.notes: Standard VA permitting. Dominion Energy serves the area.

jurisdictions.name: Baltimore
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Baltimore fire code setbacks. Row house considerations.
jurisdictions.notes: Row house roofs may require additional structural review. Maryland SREC market provides incentives.

jurisdictions.name: Seattle
special_requirements: Same-day online issuance for systems <7.7 kW
No plan review needed for small systems
jurisdictions.notes: Systems under 7.7 kW can apply online with same-day issuance and no plan review. Larger systems require plan review with tiered fees.

jurisdictions.name: Spokane
jurisdictions.notes: Standard WA permitting process.

jurisdictions.name: Tacoma
jurisdictions.notes: Standard WA permitting. Tacoma Power provides interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: Portland
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Standard IFC setbacks. Historic district installations require additional review.
special_requirements: Solar Prescriptive Path for simple roofs
jurisdictions.notes: Solar Prescriptive Path streamlines simple roof installations. Historic districts may add weeks. Fees $300-$600. Clackamas County requires structural engineering for older homes.

jurisdictions.name: Salem
jurisdictions.notes: Standard OR permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Minneapolis
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: MN building code. PV arrays limited to 150 ft in any direction.
special_requirements: PV arrays max 150 ft in any direction
jurisdictions.notes: Minnesota offers SolarAPP+ permitting incentive program. Xcel Energy serves Minneapolis.

jurisdictions.name: St. Paul
jurisdictions.notes: Standard MN permitting. Xcel Energy serves the area.

jurisdictions.name: Milwaukee
jurisdictions.notes: Milwaukee amended ordinances to comply with WI solar access statute. Focus on Energy rebates available.

jurisdictions.name: Madison
jurisdictions.notes: Standard WI permitting. Madison Gas & Electric serves the area.

jurisdictions.name: Detroit
jurisdictions.notes: Online solar permitting available. MI state fee $2/panel for systems <5,000 kW inverter capacity. Median permitting time ~53 days in MI.

jurisdictions.name: Grand Rapids
jurisdictions.notes: Dedicated online solar permit application. Standard MI process.

jurisdictions.name: Columbus
special_requirements: Plans sealed by Ohio-registered design professional required
jurisdictions.notes: Requires Ohio-registered design professional sealed plans and approved special inspector for PV inspections.

jurisdictions.name: Cleveland
jurisdictions.notes: Solar defined as exterior alteration requiring building permit. Zoning review required. Fees are valuation-based.

jurisdictions.name: Cincinnati
jurisdictions.notes: Best efforts to review residential within 5 business days, commercial within 10 business days.

jurisdictions.name: Chicago
special_requirements: Licensed electrical contractor + ICC DG Installer cert required
jurisdictions.notes: Express Permit Program offers same-day approval at $275 (reduced from $375). Requires licensed electrical contractor and ICC DG Installer certification.

jurisdictions.name: Indianapolis
special_requirements: AES Indiana or Duke Energy Indiana interconnection
jurisdictions.notes: IURC approval required for grid interconnection. Standard IN permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Kansas City
jurisdictions.notes: Missouri is one of 4 states without statewide NEC adoption (exists in some cities). Check local code.

jurisdictions.name: St. Louis
jurisdictions.notes: Standard MO permitting. No statewide NEC.

jurisdictions.name: Nashville
special_requirements: Licensed and experienced electrical installer required
jurisdictions.notes: Electrical PV permits start at $75. May increase based on fixtures/equipment. TVA territory - no traditional net metering.

jurisdictions.name: Memphis
jurisdictions.notes: TVA territory. MLGW (Memphis Light Gas & Water) handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: New Orleans
special_requirements: Solar for All NOLA program available
jurisdictions.notes: Hurricane zone requires wind load calculations. Solar for All NOLA program offers free site evaluations.

jurisdictions.name: Baton Rouge
jurisdictions.notes: Standard LA permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Salt Lake City
jurisdictions.notes: Online solar permitting available. PE stamps typically required >12 kW. Rocky Mountain Power handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: Hartford
special_requirements: CT standardized solar PV permit supplement
jurisdictions.notes: CT standardized solar PV permit application supplement available. Strong ZREC/LREC incentive programs.

jurisdictions.name: Stamford
jurisdictions.notes: Standard CT permitting with standardized permit supplement.

jurisdictions.name: Honolulu
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Hawaii fire code setbacks. Wind load requirements for Pacific storm exposure.
special_requirements: Expedited permitting for systems up to 20 kW
High solar penetration area - interconnection study may be needed
jurisdictions.notes: Expedited permitting for qualifying PV systems up to 20 kW. Hawaii has highest solar penetration in US - interconnection studies sometimes required.

jurisdictions.name: Des Moines
jurisdictions.notes: Standard IA permitting. Some SolarAPP+ adoption in Iowa.

jurisdictions.name: Wichita
jurisdictions.notes: Standard KS permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Louisville
jurisdictions.notes: Standard KY permitting. LG&E serves Louisville area.

jurisdictions.name: Oklahoma City
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Enhanced wind loads for tornado area.
special_requirements: Enhanced wind load for tornado zone
jurisdictions.notes: Oklahoma Solar Rights Act prevents HOA prohibition. Enhanced wind loads for tornado area.

jurisdictions.name: Little Rock
jurisdictions.notes: Residential Building Contractor + Electrical license required in AR.

jurisdictions.name: Jackson
jurisdictions.notes: MS is one of 4 states without statewide NEC adoption. Local codes vary. Generally user-friendly permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Birmingham
jurisdictions.notes: Standard AL permitting. Alabama Power handles interconnection.

jurisdictions.name: Boise
jurisdictions.notes: Idaho requires NABCEP or similar licensing plus Idaho solar PV license for contractors.

jurisdictions.name: Albuquerque
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NM permitting. Strong solar resource.

jurisdictions.name: Omaha
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NE permitting. Building permits required per county codes.

jurisdictions.name: Providence
jurisdictions.notes: RI standardized statewide solar permit application effective 2025. Requires single-line electrical diagram with panel config, voltage, kW output.

jurisdictions.name: Wilmington
jurisdictions.notes: NABCEP license preferred for rebate eligibility. Standard DE permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Portland
jurisdictions.notes: Maine requires licensed electricians to install solar panels.

jurisdictions.name: Burlington
jurisdictions.notes: Burlington has own inspectors (most VT jurisdictions use state-level). Certificate of Public Good from VT PUC required.

jurisdictions.name: Manchester
jurisdictions.notes: Standard NH permitting.

jurisdictions.name: Charleston
jurisdictions.notes: Very low solar adoption. Licensed electrical contractor required.

jurisdictions.name: Cheyenne
special_requirements: Very high wind area - enhanced mounting
jurisdictions.notes: Very high wind area requires enhanced panel mounting. Very low solar adoption.

jurisdictions.name: Billings
jurisdictions.notes: Standard MT permitting. Growing solar interest.

jurisdictions.name: Fargo
jurisdictions.notes: Electrical and building permits required. ND State Electrical Board manages electrical permits.

jurisdictions.name: Sioux Falls
special_requirements: Xcel Energy or MidAmerican Energy interconnection
jurisdictions.notes: Building and electrical permits required. No special solar contractor license but electrical license required.

jurisdictions.name: Anchorage
jurisdictions.notes: Extreme snow loads and seismic requirements. Limited solar resource in winter but excellent summer production.
